question: Which among the following is the wrongly matched pair?
explanation:
• One of the most important events in India\'s struggle for independence took place when Mahatma Gandhi launched the Civil Disobedience Movement with his famous Dandi March, which began on 12th March1930 and ended on April 6th, 1930.
• Sir Syed Ahmed Khan started a movement in order to give respectable position to Muslims in society as they had in past and this movement is known as Aligarh Movement.
• The khilafat movement was launched by Mahatma Gandhi and the Ali brothers. It was launched to restore the Ottoman Turkish emperor Khalifat and strengthen the relationship between Muslims and Hindus of India for a combined struggle for freedom.
• The All India Forward Bloc is a left-wing nationalist political party in India. It emerged as a faction within the Indian National Congress in 1939, led by Subhas Chandra Bose.
